Reviews.Title: “Stunningly good”
Reviews.Author: IrelandAmigos
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in Villa Spalletti; we have to say its probably the best boutique hotel we have ever stayed in. The moment we arrived we were warmly greeted and advised that our room reservation had been upgraded - the Prestige Room was totally spacious, beautifully furnished and immaculate in every detail right down to complimentary dental floss!! Complimentary is a word that consistently springs to mind, whether its the mini bar in your room or the evening drinks in the library or weather permitting in the gardens. Breakfast includes freshly cooked eggs and bacon with the usual array of juices, coffees, cheeses, fruit, etc. etc. - the perfect setup for a full day of sightseeing. Last but not least the staff have mastered the art of being friendly and helpful but inobtrusive; it has to be said that if Carlsberg did hotels ....................!! Can't wait to have the opportunity to stay here again; Villa Spalletti richly deserves is rave reviews.

Reviews.Title: “reward yourself”
Reviews.Author: drIR
Reviews.Content: Three perfect days in Rome and prime experience of roman hospitality. Staff is very helpful and kind. upon our early arrival they offered us to take a shower in basements wellness area and start our sightseeing fresh, before check in. Rooms are perfect, big, with nice details (iphone docking alarm clock and free wifi allowed us to enjoy internet radio), lobby is exclusive and perfectly furnished, garden offers you peace of remote place right in the centre of Rome.Real recco, worth every penny !

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MomcatNH
Reviews.Content: Villa Spalletti Trivelli is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in anywhere. Based on reviews on Trip Advisor and their website I chose it as the place for my 17 year old son and I to stay during our trip to Rome and was not the least bit disappointed. We will definitely be back. The rooms are huge and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a wonderful way to start the day with many choices and they are centrally located making sightseeing easy. There are many lovely restaurants in all price ranges within walking distance, some nice shopping and beautiful gardens to enjoy both behind the villa and at the public park across the street. Many thanks for a fabulous week in Rome. We cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “a well deserved award”
Reviews.Author: nicholas n
Reviews.Content: Only because Trip Advisor told me. From the moment you are greeted at the front door, you feel at home. It is beautiful in architecture and appointments i.e., bedrooms, bathrooms, closets, art, linens, etc, all the modern conveniences in a traditional home with12-15 foot georgeous walls, staircases, moldings and ceilings. Three large comfortable interior rooms for sitting and reading by the three fires or having the always complimentary drinks. There is no charge for any wine or liquor downstairs or from the minibar in your room. Delicious chocolates and nuts are always available.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect week...just like my own home in Rome...if I were a Count”
Reviews.Author: AustinWL
Reviews.Content: In Rome, I have found smaller is always better. And I have stayed in several of the top places on TA's list of "small superstars". But the Villa S-T is an experience beyond them all. It is pretty darn close to perfect; unbeatable location right in the middle of things, but astonishingly quiet; a grand Roman villa that feels like exactly what it was until recently...the home of a Roman aristocrat. It is beautiful, but at the same time comfortable and "homey". And has a wonderful garden for chilling out. The service is correct, friendly, and attentive without being cloying. I was on an unusual trip, which I had originally booked for four days. The Villa was so great that i extended for three more and hired a car (thru them) to take me to my out of town meetings rather than change hotel. I have stayed in most of the top hotels in London, Beijing, New York, Tokyo, and Bangkok over the years. I would not rate ANY of them higher than my stay here. And though it is not cheap, by comparison it is a bargain. So when you have a really special trip to Rome for pleasure, or want to feel at home for business, this is the place. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb in every way - a really special experience”
Reviews.Author: Oscar R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Spalletti Trivelli for five nights and it was wonderful. I have stayed in many expensive places before but never have they seemed so perfect and excellent value for money. Our room was very large, quiet, and beautifully furnished, with a lovely large bathroom. The staff were outstandingly helpful, friendly yet discrete and professional, and the quality of the breakfast was really exceptional. The three ground floor sitting rooms were truly gracious, and the log fires were just the thing for February evenings. In short, this was the finest hotel I have stayed in and I cannot recommend it highly enough. For that special occasion (we were on our honeymoon) it will provide a superb base for visiting the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “nice and central”
Reviews.Author: bobdinesout
Reviews.Content: enjoyed my stay at this hotel ,it lived up to its high rating .service was good and very friendly .room service worked very good and the hotl was impecably clean.i would recommend and will return on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: myholidayhints
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a family home of a wealthy Roman family and it still has that atmosphere today. You are greeted personally at the door and you then walk into a different world. All the public rooms are beautifully appointed with antiques and paintings.There is no bar just a huge table with every drink you can think of, to help yourself. The bathroom and bedroom were immaculate and very beautiful. Amazingly this hotel is right in the middle of Rome, minutes away from the Trevi Fountain. It was simply lovely to come back to this calming enviroment after a hectic day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Why should I tell you?”
Reviews.Author: Magpie1969
Reviews.Content: Only because Trip Advisor told me. From the moment you are greeted at the front door, you feel at home. It is beautiful in architecture and appointments i.e., bedrooms, bathrooms, closets, art, linens, etc, all the modern conveniences in a traditional home with12-15 foot georgeous walls, staircases, moldings and ceilings. Three large comfortable interior rooms for sitting and reading by the three fires or having the always complimentary drinks. There is no charge for any wine or liquor downstairs or from the minibar in your room. Delicious chocolates and nuts are always available. It's February and we had a lovely luncheon out in the sunny garden. When a cloud came by, a buzzer at our chair brought assistance to turn on the outside heater. So please, go somewhere else. Leave Villa Spalletti to us. Mille grazie.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a private palace”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller1953
Reviews.Content: Wow.Beautiful property , gorgeous furnishings , paintings, decor - lovely family villa but huge withjust 12 rooms .Superb lounges,public areas,romantic,warm ,open fires,complimentary drinks.Marvellous wellness area ,well equipped gym ,hamman, steam room etc .Bedrooms are luxurious,marble bathrooms .Unique place to sty and compared to the top end hotels ie Russie or Eden is sensibly priced .Great location as well.Small salt float pool .No large pool

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! A well deserved award”
Reviews.Author: BrazilMaria
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel because of the Trip Advisor award and its location, not only a few steps from the gardens of the Palazzo Quirinale but also from the Fontana di Trevi, Via Nazionale, and the mostly known attractions in Rome. Decoration, service, atmosphere, attention, food (breakfast) it was all supreme. To us there is only one hotel in Rome - The Villa Spalletti Trivelli. Congratulations to the all the people at Villa Spalletti Trivelli!!

Reviews.Title: “Please go there”
Reviews.Author: Heinz B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights for a friend's 50th. Had the Grand Suite and a "normal" double. The place is really exceptional. Very central but still very quiet (surrounded by government buildings). Breakfast, cleanliness, style, included minibar + snacks, spa... everything is just perfect. We'll definitely revisit.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: david w
Reviews.Content: During my last vacation in Italy after a cruise I've spent at Villa some nights with my wife! The hotel was very good located and the suite was nice even if the price was a little bit too high fot what it was offering ( miss something essentials amenties for that price), it was well cleaned even if the soaps were not replaced every day!! The staff was very friendly and helpfull and I'll come back again there if I'll be back in Rome hoping in a cheaper price!!

Reviews.Title: “impressed”
Reviews.Author: Nina P
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a fantastic location, great breakfast buffet, very nice and clean rooms, and provides with everything you could need.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely find”
Reviews.Author: grace c
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. A real find. Attentive staff. Food delicious. Wished I could have stayed longer but on my way further south. Will definitely go back for a longer stay

Reviews.Title: “Believe everything you read about this villa”
Reviews.Author: kazu100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa from November 3rd until the 7th. What a fabulous, fabulous place to stay. Our room was huge (booked the prestige) light and airy. The bathroom was absolutely wonderful. Breakfast was wonderful - you could order eggs or toast if you so chose and we did several mornings! The staff could not do enough for you and we found them to be warm and very helpful. They were happy to give advice, call cabs, whatever you needed. The complimentary drinks at night were really very nice (as was the complimentary mini bar) We met fellow guests and had a wonderful time chatting with them. I noticed with interest on another review one person complaining that there was no coffee machine in the room. This is Europe after all! I just slipped down to the dining room and got us coffees and brought them back. No problem at all and it more than did the trick for us. The public rooms are lavish, but did not feel cold. The gardens were enjoyable to sit in even though it was late in the year. We have stayed in many hotels and even suites. This is definitely a fabulous place to stay. Away from the hustle and bustle, intimate and relaxing, and yet, just a few steps from the main sites. The staff and hotel are fabulous - I cannot recommend it high enough. Worth the price to us

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodation for a perfect Roman holiday!..”
Reviews.Author: Olga_Perevertova
Reviews.Content: Wow!... The unique property lies in the very heart of the Eternal City on Quirinale Hill, right opposite to the Palazzo del Quirinale. But despite its central location, Villa Spalletti Trivelli is sheltered from the inherent noise of cars and Rome daily routine. There are theaters, art galleries and museums, as well as other world-famous sites of Rome in a pace approachability from the hotel: Palazzo del Quirinale (3 minutes walk), the Trevi Fountain (5 minutes walk), Colloseum (10 minutes walk), Spanish Square and Spanish Steps (15 minutes), Piazza Navona (20 minutes walk). One of the remarkable sites of the area, without a doubt, is the Villa itself. The interiors are designed in a very elegant style which repeats decoration of aristocratic Roman homes: you would be amazed by luxury furniture, antiques, expensive fabrics, rich colors, beautiful pictures and flower arrangements … Our room was very spacious, bright, tastefully decorated and overlooked the picturesque neighborhood. The bathroom was a true oasis of peace and tranquility and had shower, bath and eco-friendly toiletries by R.E.N. Hammam and tea session in a relaxing room is an absolute must after a full day of sightseeing – shame that we walked down to the SPA zone only once during our visit!.. And the last, but not the least: they serve aperitif (local prosecco, whiskies, cognacs, light snacks) in the living room during evening hours - you would probably not want to leave)

Reviews.Title: “The best ever”
Reviews.Author: Trooper1941
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here and were so pampered by the friendy staff who only have 12 rooms to look after! It is impossible to find any fault with this hotel - no wonder it is at the top of the TripAdvisor ratings. We have stayed in the best five star hotels that the Middle East has to offer but this place tops them all - mainly because it is such an intimate place. It was like staying with your wealthy relatives in their Roman villa and not having to worry about a thing because it's all taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “A Secret Gem in the heart of Rome...”
Reviews.Author: eGreenGoes
Reviews.Content: It was an absolute joy to stay at Villa Spalletti, don't think of a hotel - it feels more like your own home while you are there. The staff couldn't be more helpful and remembered us throughout our stay. Our room was spacious and peaceful, even though the villa is situated very centrally and within walking distance to many tourist attractions, with Trevi fountain only 3 minutes walk away. Every last detail was immaculate - from the extensive toiletries in the bathroom to the complimentary mini bar. The public rooms downstairs presented the perfect opportunity to enjoy the families collection of antiques and books while sipping the Champagne from the open bar before leaving for dinner. Overall, a beautifully traditional asset to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Lynn T
Reviews.Content: We have just spent four days at this wonderful hotel for our anniversary. There was a slight misunderstanding regarding our room, most probably mine, which was sorted out by giving us an upgrade. This small thing on their behalf made my whole holiday, the room was brilliant a pleasure to come back to. If I had the smallest of complaints it would be the lack of tea making facilities after a long day. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, booking taxis, arranging restaurants, plus the added bonus of knowing guides to show you around the Vatican. Going with a guide allows you to miss the huge queues but do make sure when booking what the cost entails, we didn't realise that we would have to pay for the guide's ticket as well as our own plus the cost of the tour. Having said that Reema, our guide, certainly knew her stuff. When we come back we will not hesitate to return to this hidden gem as it is right in the middle of Rome so you can walk everywhere, providing your feet don't give up on you.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Soonerpack
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Rome. On our first visit we stayed near the Pantheon. Although the location was ideal it was extremely noisy and the rooms were only average for an $800 a night room. The Villa Spalletti although off the beaten path was still within walking distance for two 36 year olds in average shape. The rooms were perfect. We also stayed at the Four Seasonsin Florence on this trip. The rooms were comparable. The bathrooms are five star. The breakfast was very good although with a strong European flair. Our flight landed at 7:00 am and our room was ready, which started the trip off right. We hardly noticed the staff, which is how we like our service. When we did need assistance the staff was prompt and attentive. The garden area was quiet and secluded. In fact we never saw another guest in the three days we were at the hotel. In summary you would be a fool to stay anywhere else in Rome unless the place is booked.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: uzule
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find a thing to complain about. Service is great and personal, breakfast buffet opulent, good size room (we stayed in Romantic Double). But the thing that makes it special is feeling that you are visiting a distant relative who has invited you for a weekend in his Roman family house – it’s all very private and sumptuous. Amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Aziraphale
Reviews.Content: How this place isn't no. 1 in Rome is beyond me. Pallatial opulent rooms, fantastic service, incredible breakfast. We loved it so much we're heading back for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional luxury”
Reviews.Author: Pam K
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is located in an elegant tree-lined smart part of town. It is a huge spacious town house with its own garden. For such a massive house, there are only twelve rooms but plenty of large dignified reception rooms downstairs filled with antiques, rugs and important looking paintings. Our room was large, friendly and with the most comfortable bed - not state of the art but solid and traditional. The marble bathroom was enormous, modern and glamorous which was kept scrupulously clean by the household staff, who we never saw. Breakfasts were such a pleasant experience with top quality food in a lovely calm atmosphere and delightful unobtrusive staff. The spa downstairs was pretty glam too - offering every treatment known to man. I would say this hotel was one of the best we have stayed in - and we are very picky!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant, beautiful, Roman property”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the summer of 2011, after searching for a centrally located place to stay in Rome. For reference, the parameters were central, with enough room for a family and a nanny. We ended using the Apartment and one room in the main building. The wonderful things included the courteous and attentive staff, the morning breakfast in the dining room, the beautiful public spaces (as a converted mansion, it's as if you are staying in the home of a Rich, VERY RICH, Italian friend--there is a richness and authenticity to the spaces which is remarkable), the very, very secure neighborhood, blissfully powerfully air conditioning and the walking distance to Trevi, Parthenon, etc...(remember, you walk a lot more Europe and it's good for you!). The apartment is not in the main building; it's in a building about 100 feet away, which contains business offices and whatnot (must have also been owned by the same rich family)--and on a high floor. It has a full kitchen, a living room and two bedrooms and two baths. The one bedroom has two twin beds and the other a king. The mattresses are firm and the housekeeping immaculate (no room service in the Apartment, however; and the WiFi never worked correctly while we there). One cautionary note to ANY visitor to Rome who plans on sleeping at night at any point before 2-3 AM---It's a loud City (you knew that) and the primary offender is the sputtering cavalcade of scooters that carry young and old alike to and fro through the City. This means that even in the private rented apartments of apparently wealthy Romans---there's noise at night from the street. Earplugs are your friend. Nanny reported that the main hotel's bedrooms had the same issue. Of course, if we had been going out until 3:00 am ourselves (with the 4 and 7 year old, hmmm, is this a bad idea?), we would have never noticed.... Also, although I would stay in the Apartment again with children, I am not sure that the main hotel building would be a good fit---far, far too many antiques of ancient (and expensive) provenance left casually on the walls and whatnot that could be nerve-wracking. For a couple with means---I think this would be delightful place to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in the heart of Rome - can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent was going to put us up in a large, commercialized hotel during our honeymoon in Italy/Rome. I had asked them to change us into a hotel that had more "Italian history and charm" and they hit the nail on the head! The Villa Spalletti Trivelli is an absolute hidden GEM in the heart of Rome (~5 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain, ~10 minutes to the Spanish Steps). This used to be the private residence of the last queen's first lady in waiting. In 2003 they renovated the entire house into a 12 bedroom hotel and it is spectacular!!! - the rooms were very much preserved in their original form (original pictures of the queen/family, furniture, art, tapestries) but still has the comforts and luxuries of a 5-star hotel. We happened to be in Rome during the recent protests and although there were blaring sirens and helicopters sounding off outside, we were able to retreat to our EXTREMELY QUIET room and take a much needed nap! The staff at the hotel is very accommodating and knowledgeable of what to do/where to eat in Rome that are not tourist traps. Also, there is a roof top balcony in which to go watch the sunset at night and enjoy a glass of wine!!... Such a WONDERFUL and romantic hotel - most of the locals have no idea where it is and that's part of the ambiance! We can't wait to come back for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners Heaven”
Reviews.Author: purplepixie71
Reviews.Content: Nestled away in the heart of Rome, moments from the romantic Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps, is the Villa Spalletti Trivelli. We visited the Villa for the last two nights of our honeymoon in Italy. As soon as we arrived, we knew it wouldn’t be long enough. At the first opportunity, we went to toss a coin into the Trevi Fountain to ensure our return. The villa was once a family home and is crammed with Spalletti Trivelli family heirlooms. The wood paneling and fireplaces give an air of grand aristocracy but the friendly, if formal, service ensured a very comfortable stay. Beautiful gardens where you are invited to enjoy your meals or drinks, a lovely breakfast and dining room and a drawing room with a fully-stocked complimentary honesty bar. If you tire of taking in the many sights of Rome, the spa at the villa offers welcome respite. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and even after checking out, we were still offered afternoon tea and the use of the beautiful spa changing facilities whilst we waited for our transport. The room we stayed in (a romantic double) was comfortable with all the ameneties you would expect from a 5-start hotel, plus beautiful views of the surrounding gardens. For the average travellers like us, at €360 per night the Villa Spalletti Trivelli is expensive. But well worth every penny as the memory will remain with you for life.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem in a Busy City”
Reviews.Author: Lovingagoodholiday
Reviews.Content: What can I say – this is just a gorgeous place. There are 12 deluxe rooms of various types at the Villa, we tried two, the first of which was a prestige double with a balcony overlooking a lovely park. It was a large room with king sized bed, walk in wardrobe/dressing room and gorgeous bathroom with all amenities (the towels and robes are to die for). The room rate includes a bar fridge filled with beer, water, soft drink and spirits; all you can drink. The breakfast room is divine with lovely china and table wear. You can choose from the Continental breakfast which is laid out from 7 am to 11 am (very generous), or you can ring a bell and have something cooked fresh. (This is much better than the standard hot buffets, where everything ends up cold and chewy.) The hedged garden is very nice, especially in the early evening when complimentary bar service runs for a number of hours and it’s very pleasant to sit and relax after a hard days touring on comfy lounges and just enjoy the fresh air. There’s also a roof top area with lovely views, more lounges and water on ice for guests’ use. The downstairs area is decorated beautifully and has lots of quiet reading areas, or just places to relax and chat. It’s very centrally situated; walking distance to many of the sights and the staff are very friendly and happy to help with taxi’s, tour bookings and restaurant recommendations. While not exactly cheap, the website is a true depiction of what your money buys (unlike some sites where they make the rooms look huge and they’re the size of a closet). It's quite luxurious actually and I cannot recommend this boutique hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “***THE Place to Stay in Rome***”
Reviews.Author: vancouverfamily6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa in mid July for 5 nights. There were 7 of us travelling. My hubby, myself our 4 boys and our nanny. We had an amazing stay at the villa. Since there were 7 of us staying at the hotel, we booked the hotel's apartment which had more than sufficient room for all of us to stay. Even though we had to walk a few meteres to get to the main part of the hotel, we were able to use all of the amazing ammenities and had our daily mid day break in the beautiful, secluded garden.The apartment was very clean, nicely decorated new bathrooms and kitchen. Washer/dryer, air conditioning in all of the rooms. The bathrooms had very nice toiletries. The kitchen had unlimited free drinks, juice, water, liquor. I am quite picky on where I want to stay and it has to be clean. this was IT. Customer service was SUPERB. The staff at this boutique hotel were some of the best in the world, and we have travelled a lot. We were close to everything, the coloseum, Trevi Fountain, Presidential palace, Vatican, Pantheon, lots of great Gelato shops, restaurants etc. We walked everywhere. In short, STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Irene: Our Problem”
Reviews.Author: TokyoTravelingPilot
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately didn't have the chance to stay in Villa Spalletti Trivelli as part of our honeymoon, which we had very much been looking forward to, as we were caught in a very frustrating extended flight delay due to Hurricane Irene on the East Coast of the United States. As soon as I found out our flight had been cancelled, I sent a copy of the cancelled itinerary to Villa Spalletti management to show evidence of our predicament. I also called the reservations agent in Rome to let them know, more than three days before we were to arrive. Our flights were cancelled multiple times because of the hurricane, causing us to lose several days of our honeymoon. :-( I was informed that Villa Spalletti management would need to subsequently rule on our case as to the deposit. After an extended delay, I was informed that our deposit would be non-refundable, despite the clearly beyond-our-control circumstances of our inability to begin our honeymoon as planned, and the substantial efforts we had made to show good faith and communicate the circumstances to them in as timely a manner as possible. I had very much looked forward to our stay, and am surprised that such a fine hotel would treat us in this fashion, when the cause of our change of plans was very clearly and publicly out of our control, and we gave them ample opportunity as soon as we could to put the room back up for reservations. Villa Spalletti Trivelli sounds like a beautiful place with great reviews, but didn't show good faith in our case, making an already frustrating situation at the outset of our honeymoon all the more dispiriting. We had a wonderful time during the remainder of our honeymoon, elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “"OUR EVERY YEAR ESCAPE"”
Reviews.Author: Maukyt
Reviews.Content: To all who are considering staying in Villa Spalletti Trivelli! This very private place,which has a fairytail ,magic charm, is one and only hotel we'd stay in Rome. Minute you ring masive,antique doors you are entering the most beautifull place in the city. This palazzo with fireplace, antique furniture, soft carpets, beautifull paintings and gobelins on the walls,where you rest after exploring Rome has everything you wish for on your relaxing holidays. It's quiet, warm place where you are aloud to enjoy old times charm with complimentary drinks by fireplace and listen just to clock ticking. Rooms are amazing overlooking garden or little street.Breakfast is delicious and has a great selection. Thank to all wonderfull people of Villa Spalletti Trivelli!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Villa... Exemplary staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Headys55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Spalletti for 4 luxurious nghts. A true secret, close enough to the madness of Rome CBD but far enough away to chill out. Elio and all the staff are exceptional. Nothing was too much trouble. All staff are bilingual. The Spa and Turkish bath is out of this world. Beautiful breakfast buffet which we took out to the exquisitely manicured gardens. The detail in room finishes, crockery, furnishings are all of a beautiful standard. This was the first 4 nights of our holiday and boy - did these guys set the bar high! we absolutely loved it and will definitely be back!,

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we ever visited”
Reviews.Author: JimsBuddy
Reviews.Content: After 6-7 trips to Europe, each with a splurge or two, this is absolutely the best hotel we ever visited. Located off the beaten path overlooking a quiet park at the top of Quirnal Hill, you ring the doorbell of a Reniassance home to summon the reception. Great! our room is ready, but not before a guided tour of the museum-like public areas. Rooms were impeccable, every amenity imagineable, including a complimentary minibar. The entire staff was professional and gracious. For example, we had to change plane reservations home due to Hurricane Irene...staff helped dial the airline and offered me a drink while I sat on hold! Breakfasts and dining room decor are indescribable. There's also a beautiful garden in back with a covered patio for cocktails and another is an optional breakfast area...you'd never know you were 200 yards from Via Navionale. This is a fantastic, magical place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CastleNY
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to see a negative review on here because we found it to be absolutely amazing. It was elegant and stately without being one bit pretentious. I took my parents here on their first ever trip to Italy and have to say that the Villa was one of the highlights of the week. The suite was comfortable and lovely and provided lots of privacy. We also enjoyed the complimentary cocktails in the evening! I couldn't say enough good things about this place - well worth the money. The one note is that the staff had recommended a restaurant around the corner from the hotel, Rinaldi (?). It turned out to really just be a mediocre tourist trap which was overpriced so I would suggest avoiding it.

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: TipperaryStan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is class. It is beautifully decorated throughout. Our bedroom was without fault; huge and comfortable bed. The bathroom was of an extremely high standard. The staff are friendly, discrete and welcoming. Breakfast is first class. The garden provides welcome peace and quiet from the city beyond. The aperitifs on offer (all day) are ideal. Thoroughly recommended. Simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel... excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Bernard_charente
Reviews.Content: In Italy sometimes, this is really not easy to find a good service... a really good i mind! In this place all, really was perfect nothing is living without attention, every details, every moment, every question.... The room are really nice, decoration is beautifull and nothing to tell about the cleanness... I will recommend it for everybody for a perfect stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Henry R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for my 40th birthday and, my goodness, I was thoroughly pampered. This beautiful palazzo is to be seen to be believed and is tastefully decorated with fine antiques and objets d'art in the public rooms.The junior suite (Colonna) that my wife booked was also of very high quality and very comfortable. The staff were very pleasant and helped enormously in suggesting and booking restaurants throughout our 4 night stay, all of which were exceptional. Great selection for breakfast and pre meal drinks in the drawing room. There reallly is nothing to fault this place and all the reviews are true (and in Rome too!). Go there and make a special ocassion truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “too bad we were out sightseeing instead of spending more time at our hotel!”
Reviews.Author: b_p0lly
Reviews.Content: this hotel was perfect for my family! i only wish we had more time indoors to fully enjoy it. the staff was nice, not the best english in the world, but very helpful. we found it to be very comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and great service, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: nattur72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon in Europe. We only stayed for 2 nights, which wasn't enough, but we had a fantastic time. The room we had was stunning, the property in general is superb and the little touches and the made the stay very memorable. Franco and the rest of the team at the hotel couldn't do enough for us as we really felt like we were very special guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jo-jorolo
Reviews.Content: Great location, and absolutely no detail overlooked. We were thoroughly spoilt. If only other hotels would take note of the simple thoughtful extras that make such a difference and sets this hotel apart from many of the others. Complimentary mini bar. Simple, all we drank were some soft drinks from it, didn't abuse the system. Complimentary drinks in the lounge before leaving for dinner, wonderful. Breakfast was fantastic, with top quality ingredients. Really looking forward to returning some time in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Feel as an Italian noble in this "palazzo"”
Reviews.Author: sicilian45
Reviews.Content: The exterior does not tell you very much about you are going to see inside. Every space in the building is special. From the breakfast room with a garden adjoin, to the library where you can have an afternoon tea or drink, all are set up as they were in the past. When you reach your suite, you will enjoy the comfort of the set up and space available. A word of caution, the windows can block the light so efficiently that you can oversleep and lose precious hours of walking around Rome. The service is discrete and efficient making you feel at home. An excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fieldmom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights in July. I felt like a pampered baroness at her private home. There are 3 very large drawing rooms on the main floor in addition to a beautiful dining room, where breakfast is served. The drawing rooms have lovely tapestries and comfortable couches, books and photos of the family that once owned this palatial residence. The garden behind the villa has two areas--one with tables for eating breakfast or a light dinner, and the other with comfortable cushioned couches for enjoying a drink or reading. Our room (number 7) overlooked the garden. A corner room, the French-style windows, opened up during the day to the sunlight and had shutters that slid out from the walls to block out early morning light. I am a frequent traveller, and I am very picky about the hotels that I stay in. This was unlike anywhere I have stayed for several reasons: The refrigerator in the room is stocked with miniature bottles of liquor, all of which are free. In the evening a sideboard in one of the drawing rooms is set with Prosecco, ice and every other liquor you could want. You just help yourself and settle into one of the chairs in the garden or inside. In the morning we went down to breakfast in the beautiful dining room with the doors open to the garden. There were trays of meats and cheeses, jams and pastries, many juices, yogurt and pudding, delicious coffee and teas. When you arrive at VST, you will ring a doorbell set into a small brass plate. Someone promptly opens the door to let you in. The hotel is quiet and private, extraordinarily beautiful and convenient to all sites. We walked to everything, never needing a cab. What a delightful place! You would never imagine you were in a hotel. Just extraordinary in every way!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: MikeN_Omaha
Reviews.Content: Our last stop on our two-week Italian trip was the Villa Spalletti Trivelli. What a gem. This lovely Villa has 12 or 14 suites. Ours had a very large bedroom, separate bathroom and a separate office. Our room also looked out over the Villa’s private garden. This was the perfect base from which to visit all of Rome’s sites, no more than a 15 minute walk anywhere (except the Vatican). The room rate also came with a very nice breakfast, unlimited mini bar and afternoon/evening cocktails. This hotel was by far the most reasonably priced of all of the hotels we visited on our trip. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone. I’d like to put in a plug for a local restaurant, Rinaldi al Quirinale www.rinaldialquirinale.com. Another couple we met at the hotel recommended it to us highly (in fact eating having eaten at the restaurant three nights in a row!) It is just around the corner from the Villa. My wife actually walked down to the restaurant on our second to last night in Rome after I had “hit the wall” and decided to take a brief nap. A short while later I was certainly surprised to find one of the restaurant’s waiters at my door with a tray of food. He had walked up the hill with my “to go” order! We ate dinner at this restaurant again the next night and had a great time. The entire staff greeted my wife who had remembered her from the night before and they kept us entertained the rest of the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jjames34
Reviews.Content: It's unusual for me to write a hotel review, but this excellent hotel deserves a mention. We travel frequently in Europe and often with our children (12 & 14). We booked a suite for the 4 of us which turned out to be 2 large beautiful bedrooms with amazing bathrooms (awesome bath products) and an interior hallway. The kids loved the free mini-bar (not a big deal but nice) and we loved having a glass of champagne out the back before going to dinner. The staff at the front desk were helpful with dinner recommendations. This was really an oasis in the middle of hot and busy Rome. We slept better here than anywhere else during our 3 weeks of travel. Absolutely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in the middle of all the major attractions!”
Reviews.Author: PKARRA-Vacationers
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Villa Spalletti while celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. We loved this hotel. We are used to large luxury hotels in the states so the transition to a smaller hotel made us nervous. However, the staff of the hotel made our stay wonderful. Our room was a very nice size with EXCELLENT airconditioning. The bathroom was totally modern and luxurious. It was almost as big as the bedroom. The staff helped us with all arrangements for tours, dinners, taxis, etc. after we arrived. The internet connection was wired but it worked perfectly. The location is one of the best things for this hotel. It is on a quiet secluded street across from a park so there is NO street noise. You only hear birds at night! However, you are one block from a major street and within easy walking distance from ancient Rome, Spanish steps and shopping area, Piazza Navona, and the Pantheon (although we consider an easy walk being less than 15 minutes - we did a TON of walking in Rome as it is a very large city). The only concern we had was trying to communicate with the hotel before going. For some reason, they couldn't email us and we had to call to confirm everything. That made me worried about their internet and I almost cancelled. I am so happy I didn't. We traveled all through Italy and this was our favorite hotel. I also read some reviews that said the staff couldn't speak English. This simply wasn't true. We speak no Italian and had no trouble communicating with the staff. They also have a WONDERFUL breakfast and in the evenings you can help yourself to free cocktails or wine and sit in the garden to unwind after a busy day of touring before going to bed. It was awesome. I would definitely recommend Villa Spalletti!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Flawed”
Reviews.Author: sen_gypsy
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and son in this very beautiful small hotel during the last week of May. Its a truly cosy luxurious experience and there are enough good reviews already by previous travellers - I agree with most of them. The location is amazingly central. the private gardens are amazing and there is a feeling of exclusiveness as soon as you enter the villa. The breakfast is wonderful. Having said all these, I need to point out the areas for improvement. A standard facility of a tea/ coffe maker in the room is absent - I do believe this is a simple miss and I am sure the hotel will correct it soon. But what makes it a bit irritating is an additional room service fee of eur 15 for a eur 3 cup of tea for such a small property !!! At the tariffs that this hotel charges, I dont think this room service fee is a significant revenue stream and should be dropped. So is the absence of an iron with ironing board in the room - trivial stuff but one expects flawlessness from such an expensive property. I will however recommend this hotel as a truly one in a million experience if you can afford it...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! They've thought of everything...”
Reviews.Author: triptravelBerkeley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Spalletti Trivelli for four nights over Easter. Rome was mobbed, and it was wonderful to have the elegance and quiet of this hotel to return to at the end of the day. They have thought of every possible comfort, and they accommodate every request. Your minifridge has complimentary alcohol, soft drinks, and snacks. The breakfast is a huge buffet of possibilities in a high-ceilinged room, with staff very attentive. Our room was quiet, our bathroom huge. It rained, but we did walk around the garden, where it would be very pleasant to sit. The neighborhood is quiet and safe. This is 5-star accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Timeless elegance in an aristocratic setting”
Reviews.Author: julianpope
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in this luxurious hotel. It was worth every penny, luxurious with impeccable and discreet service. A calm oasis from the hustle and bustle of Rome

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: DaringMiss
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at Villa Spalletti Trivelli, and I had to post a review. Our stay was exactly what I was hoping it would be. This was a special Easter trip for my mother and I and I wanted everything to be perfect. It truly was! The rooms are big and the tall windows gives them the impression of being even larger. The photos on the site don't do the rooms justice. My favorite part of the morning was putting back the inner wooden shutters and opening the windows to let in the beautiful spring air. The bathrooms were beautifully equipped and housekeeping was impeccable. The beds looked a little different from American hotel beds, but they were comfortable and the linens are to die for - crisp and lovely. Truly la dolce vita! The concierge staff is professional and extremely helpful. The kitchen staff is terrific - willing to do whatever you ask (hot breakfast or espresso in the garden) with a smile. My mother and I really enjoyed sitting in the salons in the evening, reviewing our day's adventures, sipping from the honor bar. The surroundings, the graceful style of it all, the ready but unobtrusive service, all made our stay as wonderful as could ever have been expected. Undoubtedly expensive, but worth every penny if you value a good hotel as part of your travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Dana13
Reviews.Content: It's not a regular hotel. The facilities are up to or exceed a 5-start hotel (especially the fitness and spa areas) but it's intimate in a way that a large hotel could never be. It's like living in Rome for a few days in really nice digs.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home for a princess”
Reviews.Author: cmc292
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and it will not be our last. We love this quiet, elegant villa. It is so nice to have a glass of wine or a martini in the great room before going out to dinner. The mini-bar is free though we are not big consumers of the contents. They have chips, chocolates, nuts, sparkling water, gin, vodka, rum, and more. One very much appreciated touch is that the room is available in the morning. After an all night flight I just want to get into the room and not wait hours and hours to do so. The breakfast is top-notch. I love the organic malt yogurt, phenomenal cheeses, flaky cornetto, coffee my way/ your way, and more. The staff is great. No request was unmet. We will be back time and again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: FVtraveler1119
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last three days of our Italian honeymoon at the Villa Spaletti Trivelli after returning from Capri and were very impressed with the villa. Except for the presence of the front desk, one would never know he was in a hotel, the surroundings made one feel like an honored guest at a private aristocratic home. The attention to detail was obvious in all respects, from the complimentary bar and drinks to the bathroom fixtures and linens. The hotel was immaculately decorated with antiques and artwork in every hall and in the guest rooms. The common areas and library are exquisite. The location is central to the city, we walked to all of the sights. The staff was very helpful arranging dinners and lunch for us and made helpful suggestions. Yes, the hotel is expensive, but so is Rome, it was one of the highlights of our trip and will stay there again. Picked the hotel based on trip advisor reviews which I have found to be spot on in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: DocRobert2000
Reviews.Content: We spent the last portion of our vacation in Rome and stayed here. It was one of the highlights of our trip. The hotel itself is beautiful. The service was excellent and breakfast every morning was wonderful. The location was great for us as well. The rooms were beautiful and the bathrooms even better. I would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “the Definition of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: verenabelriner
Reviews.Content: i dont have to say much this hotel is the definition of excellence in both service, facilities, luxury. we had an amazing time there and will go back again soon. instead of writing a full review i placed everything un one phrase. this hotel is the definition of excellence

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, restful "home" in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: PerthSammylou
Reviews.Content: My husband, and our adult daughter and I stayed for 3 nights at the Villa Spalletti recently while on a trip around Italy. What a gorgeous place. We flew into Rome from Australia and were so very happy to have chosen such an amazingly warm and inviting villa after a tiring, long flight. We stayed in a lovely room with an "annex" for my daughter. It was perfect. The location is wonderful and the rooms, and grounds are lovely. The front desk staff were very gracious, helping with our numerous questions and needs. They seemed MORE than happy to help us in any way they could. The breakfast was delicious and the drinks in the evening were much appreciated as was the complimentary minibar, a very nice touch! Our daughter loved having the gym to use each morning. What a perfectly wonderful start to our vacation. Thanks to everyone at the Villa Spalletti Trivelli. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our finest hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: SAErick
Reviews.Content: In preparation for our first trip to Italy, my wife and I spent quite a bit of time researching hotels in Rome, Florence and Venice. Largely based upon reviews we read on Trip Advisor, we booked Villa Spalletti Trivelli for four nights. We are so happy we did. Without question, this is the finest hotel at which we have stayed in our years of traveling. The staff could not have been more professional and helpful. The quality of our room and public spaces was at the highest level. Great location. We walked to all the popular sites. At the end of the day, we made ourselves drinks at the open bar and then played cards on the outdoor covered patio. A great, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto....”
Reviews.Author: YasirTK
Reviews.Content: very very cozy, felt like a home in Rome. excellent location, really good service.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect-comfortable, friendly, beautiful sitting areas in great location with fab hamman”
Reviews.Author: BillieWinchester
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here and I cannot praise the hotel more highly. The staff are friendly unobtrusive and speak excellent English. It is a small palazzo with 12 bedrooms with extremely comfortable beds-we were upgraded to huge rooms with high ceilings. From 5.30pm a drinks tray is left on the sideboard in one of the beautiful living rooms. There are 3 -one with an open fire, a second being a stunning library and the third a huge drawing room with comfortable sofas and chairs and delicious chocolates on hand in trays. Breakfast is served in a separate room with frshly squeezed orange juice, an array of cakes, ham and cheeses, breads yoghurt and fruit and then panckes, eggs of any variety and bacon. The location is ideal as you can walk to any of the sights on foot and yet it is peaceful opposite a small park and it has its own garden. the highlight at the end of the day after all the walking before drinks by the fire was a visit to the hamman and sauna. We also visited the gym and Francesca who is delightful did beauty treatments and massages. As it is small there were hardly any other guests around so in the evening with our drinks we had the fire to ourselves. The minibar in the bedroom with crisps and drinks (spirits,beer, water and soft drinks) was a treat-if I had a wish it would be for less spirits and say some half bottles of wine.The hotel also arranged our airport transfers in a large mercedes minivan and also a trip by car to Ostia Antica-the ancient old port-really wothwhile. What a memorable week-thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on a quiet side street near Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: lorpt
Reviews.Content: Extremely courteous staff who went out of their way to make our trip extra special. Beautifully decorated villa with many "extras". Beds very comfortable and bathroom very roomy by European standards. Breakfast was delicious with wonderful baked goods, local cheeses, and homemade jams. Can't get much better than this if you are looking for luxury, but are not into big hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Another rave...”
Reviews.Author: GiftBizGuy
Reviews.Content: Just in case you don’t believe all the “excellent” previous reviews, here’s another. This magnificent villa and its staff will make you feel very special, very relaxed, and very lucky when you visit Rome. I noticed one thoughtful “very good” review for this B&B, but I must say we did not encounter any of the negatives they noted. Smooth sailing for us. As to the one “poor” review – I share the hotel owner’s reaction of amusement combined with dismay. It concerns me that 4 Tripadvisor users have flagged this negative review as “helpful” – I do not believe that it portrays this lovely, well-managed property in a realistic light. If you can afford the splurge and might enjoy the fantasy of living in your own elegant very private Roman villa, you can book this B&B in full confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LMBEL
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in both for the standard of the room and the quality of service. The welcome from the reception team was lovely and personal. The team quite obviously actually care about the success of this hotel and they want you to be happy and comfortable. The bedrooms are of a good size, they are light and airy and the furniture is good quality. Overall an excellent experience for the first stop on our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Larry101
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching hotels for my family’s trip to Italy last summer. I found Villa Spalletti Trivelli through Trip Advisor, and was impressed by the ratings. I was not disappointed. When we arrived via taxi, I thought we were at the wrong entrance. It looked like we were at the door to someone's house, which Villa Spalletti was before being transformed into a boutique hotel. When you ring the bell, which you will do each time you return to the hotel, someone answers immediately. The interior of the Villa Spalletti is beautiful. It was obviously remodeled, but it has kept its old world charm. Our "family apartment" was two adjoining rooms sharing a single main entrance. Each room was surprisingly spacious for Rome, with king beds in each. Each room also had a full size bath with double sink vanities, seamless glass showers, and every modern amenity you could possibly want. The well-stocked minibars were complimentary, and a nice way to end a day of sightseeing in the hot August sun. The staff was great. Most of the people working the desk were young (under 30) and very fluent in English. It's a very small hotel, so the staff is readily available. There is no concierge as such, but whoever is at the desk is happy to help with directions, reservations, taxis, etc. You can't beat the location. It's within reasonable walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum, and the Pantheon. On my next trip to Rome, I wouldn’t stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable First Stay In Rome”
Reviews.Author: zurak87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Saturday to Tuesday after a 12 day Mediterranean cruise. It was the most amazing and enchanting place to stay at - on Quirinal Hill. Check out the hotels website for particulars. It is situated on Via Piacenza across from Piazza del Quirinale, a quaint one block sized city park. The hotel is just 1 block away from Quirinal Palace, Italy's White House. The neighborhood is extremely quiet due to the many government offices and lack of tourists, rarely would a car or scooter pass by. We slept with the windows open during our stay on the second floor (American 3rd floor). Since it was winter, we didn't bother turning on the AC and never used the heat due to the room being warm enough already. The hotel did stay warm in all common areas and would also fire up a fireplace nightly. The fireplace would give the hotel a warm woodsy smell. Seldomly, you could hear a small dog barking during its evening walk. Once outside the hotel, whether you made a right turn down Via Parma or a left turn down Via Della Consulta you would arrive at Via Nazionale, where you would find some action. The hotel is 10 minutes away from the Trevi Fountain. The Colloseum is a very long walk down Via dei Serpenti. The front door of the hotel is rather unassuming, until you enter the foyer with it's dual spiral staircase. The foyer is very impressive. The front desk area is small but adequate. We were asked if we wanted anything to drink. "Of course" we said and we were presented with the most fabulous cappuccinos with fancy cookies. We were handed one key with a leather key tag, very impressive. After passing through the double wooden doors, the room awakens once the key is inserted into the light switch. The fully stocked minibar is complimentary and has an awesome assortment of spirits, liquors, beers, sodas, juices, mineral water and spring water. The bathroom is extremely luxurious with a large glass enclosed shower with a detachable shower head, a marble double sink vanity, a heated towel rack, a vanity mirror, a bidet, a toilet, a tub and REN toiletries. The towels were soft and thick. The safe was located in the left closet. There were two roomy closets and a chest of four drawers. The room had a very tall window surrounded by two comfortable arm chairs with a small table with a basket of Unico chocolates and interesting reading materials. The large LCD screen, maybe a 42" screen, had several hundred channels of Sky Tv. Also in the room were a desk & chair, a superbly plush kingsize bed with two nightstands. All the lights were controlled via a box on each nightstand with six buttons. Our room had the green color scheme with a soft fabric wall paper and an immense antique map on the opposite wall. The only drawback is that there was no internet access in the rooms but complimentary wifi downstairs in the lounges. Awesome room overall. Breakfast was very complete with specialty yogurts in glass jars, fresh fruit juices, numerous cheeses, two different prosciuttos, several breads and whatever hot beverage you desired. During the evenings there was a self serve open bar that was a pleasure to use.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to discover Rome”
Reviews.Author: LouiseBays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Spalletti Trivelli for 4 nights to celebrate my husband's birthday. This is a beautiful place to stay, as many have said before, it doesn't feel like a hotel, but that you are staying in a fabulous Roman Villa with hosts who can't do enough to make your visit really special. The rooms incorporate modern luxury with Italian chic design - there is no mistake, you know you're staying in Rome. Thankyou to all the staff and I hope we will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: piatty73
Reviews.Content: We loved out two night stay. The hotel is warm and as stated before it feels like you are staying at friends Villa. The only things that were not perfect are the beds(low and a bit hard) and the climate cannot be controlled in the rooms. Once they go to heat you cannot put on the a/c. We had to leave our windows open because it was warm on the first floor. Would we stay again, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: adams005
Reviews.Content: TRIPADVISOR REVIEW Well . . . . just returned from five nights at Villa Spalletti, and I can confirm all of the earlier reviews. The place is truly amazing and special. It is intimate and refined - and everything is as advertised. Our room was beautiful and absolutely spotless (it was cleanest hotel room I have ever entered). It is also amazingly insulated -- with the windows closed in the evening, we never heard a thing outside. The breakfast is terrific (cakes, organic yogurt, fruit, juices, and eggs if you want them) with a fresh cappuccino. The location is tucked away, but nothing is far away. Most sites could be reached in under a 15 minute walk (Trevi is closest at about 5-7 minutes). The staff were very friendly and always helpful. Check-out was as pleasant as check-in, and the total was exactly as was quoted - no extra fees or charges. Cannot wait to return to Rome and Villa Spalletti (although I'm quite sure I can only afford to stay during the off-season).

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireHomeowner
Reviews.Content: You will be spoiled after you stay here and other hotels won't measure up. On a quiet street in Rome (not easy to find), sits a villa which you will wish your best friend owned (although you will feel that way after you stay here). Extremely gracious and helpful staff, gorgeous common rooms, wonderfully comfortable bedrooms and an excellent breakfast buffet with eggs cooked to order make this the hotel you wish you could find everywhere you travel. After a long overnight flight from NYC, we were met by the hotel's driver (a very worthvhile expense) who took us to the hotel where we were warmly greeted, shown around, taken to our room and made to feel like we were with friends. Just a perfect place. You won't find many ratings consistently this high any where on Trip Advisor. There's a good reason.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: emilytravels76
Reviews.Content: I stayed in there with my freind. it was great. It had a spacious room, wonderful breakfast and lgreat staff. it is a contemporary hotel in the perfect location. we got five star treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Jihanedh
Reviews.Content: Villa Spalletti Trivelli is one of the most beautiful and best hotel i have ever been too! The rooms are beautiful and very clean with a big bathroom. The villa is 5 min walk from fontana di travi. We spent 3 nights in the hotel and changed our plans to come back on our last night in Italy. The staff was very helpful and nice they helped us a lot in choosing restaurants, places to visit and so on...! The beds are very comfortable and clean. What we loved the most was the afternoon drink in the garden, it is so pleasant. We also had a great diner in the garden with a great service. The breakfast is excellent with a great variety of jams, juices, cheese, cakes... Overall it was great, the best souvenirs of our honeymoon and we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Elegance and Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: wantin2retire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay in Italy. In Rome I had the pleasure of staying at what I consider to be the finest establishment I have ever visited - Villa Spaletti Trivelli. Even after reading all of the reviews on TripAdvisor I was unprepared for what awaited us beyond the private entrance. Warmth, classic old world elegance, a sense of privacy and exceptional service. As other reviewers have noted this is a fully restored private villa. All of the art and most furniture are original antiques. The breakfast is sublime, service is warm, immediate and very helpful. The gardens are a particular highlight after a long day wandering the noisy city. Highly recommended - and I never thought I'd ever say this - but more so than any Four Seasons I've been at. The personalized feel of staying at this 12 room villa far exceeds any grand "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere Better To Stay in Rome - Magical End To Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: CJM275
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the final three nights of our honeymoon based on the excellent tripadvisor reviews and the very appealing website. We certainly were pleased we choose the Spalletti Trivelli. It's intimate, romantic, ideally located near an impressive government building and a 5-6 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. The staff were courteous and welcoming. The breakfast was divine - a luxuriously appointed buffet spread and a charming waitress who brought freshly made eggs and coffee to you upon request. The communal areas were just beautiful. Old school elegant, antiques, paintings, books galore, not to mentiona well stocked bar that could be consumed at guests' discretion. There was also a lovely garden where you could take breakfast or relax with a coffee if you needed a break from sight-seeing. Our room was absolutely divine (number 6). We had booked a "Romantic" room, which was their cheapest room, but as it was our honeymoon, they upgraded us at no extra cost. A lovely touch! The bed was comfy and they had a nightly turndown sevice. There was a walk-in wardrobe with plenty of storage for suitcases so we weren't tripping over our stuff all the time. The bathroom was exceptional. Spacious with shower cubicle big enough for two and a Villeroy&Boch bath tub (no Ideal Standard here!) and lots of products. The other touch that I'd never seen at any other hotel, was that the in-room minibar was complimentary. A really wonderful stay - I will never stay anywhere else in Rome from now on. Totally worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “magical stay”
Reviews.Author: CassGeorge
Reviews.Content: all the positive reviews of Villa Spalletti Trivelli on this site are completely accurate, it really is a magical place and a great peaceful retreat after the frentic nature of Rome. The rooms are fabulous, spacious with beautiful linens and towels and as others have mentioned, a complementary mini bar. The breakfast selection is great, with wonderful organic yoghurt, fresh fruit including figs and small balls of fresh mozzerella cheese the highlights for me. We had dinner in the garden one night and the food was outstanding, from paper thin ravioli filled with spinach and buffulo ricotta, to carpaccio of beef followed by coffee gelato. The staff could not be more helpful and we loved all the restaurants they recommended to us. Location is perfect and we walked to all the major attractions of Rome from Spalletti Trivelli. This really is a magical place and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “THEEE PLACE IN ROME..”
Reviews.Author: caligirl8639
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of booking our family vacation in Italy this August 2010. I was very nervous as my dad is extremely picky. I researched for days on where to stay in Rome, Florence and then the sea side. Research paid off !!! Trip Advisor does not lie!! Villa Spalletti Trivelli is perfect. We are still joking about the "button" that can be found in the dining area in the garden. Press the magical "button" and Switwana the maid comes running to your assistance. The Villa is beautiful, and the rooms are fabulous. We booked all the suites on the first floor, which included the Presidents Suite. I believe these rooms are larger then the average rooms there so I would definalty recommend these rooms. They overlook the garden. The bathroom was very big and luxurious too. We will be recommending this place to all our friends travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is PERFECT. Expect a heavenly stay.”
Reviews.Author: barbaraGeneva
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Rome in the heat of July made me nervous and I changed my mind on hotels three times, finally settling on this one because of the location--in a residential area near the Trevi Fountain. There are only 12 rooms, each more lovely than the next. Huge rooms, huge King bed, huge bathrooms, and all the best bedding and amenities, great ac, great TV with multitude of channels and English language audio. The common areas of the hotel are that of a private palazzo, with a garden outside for lounging, drinks or a meal. Hotel breakfast more than you could imagine eating--fresh fruit juices, fresh hams, fruits, exotic yoghurts, pastries--served until 11:00 am. Honor bar in the evening in the drawing room. New hammam (no extra cost!) and spa downstairs. The staff is friendly and discreet. At our request, management upgraded us to the most luxurious suite--just because we asked. The restaurant Rinaldi Quirenale around the corner serves dinner until 2300, and is wonderful. There were no surprises at checkout, the bill was the flat rate we had booked--everything was included.

Reviews.Title: “The Best, All Around.”
Reviews.Author: Aparticulartguest
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May, I could say so many wonderful things about this hotel..... Well, for starters we booked theleast expensive room in the hotel, myself and my husband. The room was excellent, linens high quality, bed of good quality (and I am picky) ac great, bath with shower sep tub, bidet and 2 sinks. Heated towel rack a great plus. Lots of fluffy towels, robes, good bath ameneties, and yes, washcloths -a rarity in Italy. The complimentary mini bar was a nice touch, although we were only interested in the mineral water there was beer, pop, alcohol. Hi gh speed internet worked well. Great lighting. Decor made a bright, cherry room. We heard absolutely no noise at night, windows had thick wooden shutters to block out light and sound. Is there anything I can criticize?.........I need to find something, or I will have found the perfect hotel (which I am sure cannot exist) The only clock was small and on the TV, couldn't see it well from bed and I could not find an alarm on it. I carry my cell phone ( clock and alarm) so it was no bother. You can get a wake up call from front desk. I think none of the Italian hotels I stayed in had an alarm clock. That was the room. Now, the other ameneties. Breakfast was top notch. Its worth explaining since I read a previous review that felt the breakfast was less than perfect. What a spread. Cappucino, latte etc made to order, just press the bell by the door and an attendant will come to take your order ( if she is not already there greeting you !) Choice of breads and rolls, jams honey. Pasteries and cakes. Incredible yougurt. Cereal and granola. My personal favorites, cheeses and sliced ham and salami. Of course, fresh fruit and juices. There was probably more, too. All served on fine china with real silver. Somehow that makes it taste even better. Oh, did I forget the beatiful sunshine coming through the windows which overlooked the beautiful gardens? Breakfast was served late as well, until 11. That came in really handy when we overslept on our fist (and very jet lagged) morning. Well, what else can I say....location is in a quiet part of Rome, a real plus as Rome is busy with cars and noisy on the main streets. There are still plenty of places to eat and bank machines etc nearby. The location is indeed central to most Roman sights....which brings me to some advice for getting around. Rome is spread out, it is big and hilly. If you want to walk, get in shape before your trip. The metro stop is still a bit of a walk (10min-maybe more, we walk fast) from hotel, but the metro stops in general are very spread out. I actually used a cab to hotel upon arrival from airport (good service, Roman cabs get my stamp of approval) and upon departure to train station. I feel that one of the best ways to experience a city is on its public transport and by walking, but with limited time I would indeed recommend a cab in Rome for certain trips, to save time and your feet! We had done our homework so didn't need much help with planning, but any questions we had were expertly answered by the hotel staff, they recommended excellent restaurants for us. In Italy, supper is not before 8pm. Its quite nice, really once you get used to it. You leave our key at the desk when you leave ( a custom we lack here, in North America) Its a nice personal touch. The staff know when you are gone, and housekeeping goes in and cleans your room, like magic its done when you get back. No "do not disturb" sign needed, although there was one available. I really liked the fact that you rang a bell to enter the hotel, I felt very secure because of this feature. We did not have time to use the spa/exercise facility, as we were busy sight seeing all day, but I am sure it would have been excellent judging from the rest of the hotel. There were complimentary drinks and snacks before supper hour in the lounge area, alcohol, mix, pop, prosecco........very nice touch. We had a drink and read a bit before going out one evening, very relaxing. Another helpful tip or 2...there is a travel agency just around the corner. Buy your train ticket there in advance to avoid line ups or impersonal machines at staion. The hotel has only a small sign out front and is on a side street. I gave the cab driver a map I had printed out from the hotel's website and he had a GPS (which yes he was typing into while driving us... I give Roman drivers much credit, I could not drive in Rome) but when he dropped us at the far edge of the hotel, I still think that neither I nor the driver knew exactly where the hotel was. I had remembered a photo onTA with the white steps going up to the park across the street, so when I saw the steps I knew we were at the right spot. Thanks to the TA member for that photo! Overall, the best there is in Rome, don't stay anywhere else. Downside, the Villa Spalletti Trivelli spoiled me for the rest of my Italy trip, it made my relatively adequate Venice hotel ( where I stayed next) feel like a hand me down....

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dms422
Reviews.Content: We could not have found a more perfect place to stay in Rome! This place is just wonderful. The rooms are huge by European standards, and I loved the extra high ceilings. All the interiors are beautifully decorated, and the outside garden is absolutely perfect for a midday break. All the staff there were amazing. So friendly and incredibly helpful. I cannot say enough good things about them! The breakfasts were great, more food than I could ever asked for, and delicious! I do recommend eating dinner there one night. On our first night there we opted to eat in since we knew we’d be exhausted from the trip over, and the meal was spectacular. They set us up at one of the tables in the garden, and we had the whole area to ourselves. It was just a perfect way to start the vacation, and the dessert they had was probably the most amazing thing I have ever tasted! The location can’t be beat, we were able to walk to everything! It did take a little bit to walk over to the Vatican, but it was a easy walk and we got to see a lot on the way. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone staying in Rome. It may be a bit pricey, but it’s well worth the cost!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect start to a vacation in Italy!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbev
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect start to our three week vacation in Italy. After a long flight and some jet lag we arrived at Spalletti Trivelli. This is a beautiful hotel in a quiet location and was just what we needed. We spent four nights and found that we could walk to so many of the sights. The location was perfect for us. The room was beautiful with every amenity and the buffet breakfast was the best we had while in Italy. We enjoyed the outside garden which is a beautiful place to sit with a glass of wine. It was nice to know that our daily stocked refirgerator and the bar in the main area of the hotel were all included in our room rate. It was worth paying a little more to have a wonderful start to our vacation and we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: besNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: A hidden treasure in the heart of Rome. Lovely, elegantly appointed public rooms, soothing formal garden, very nice gym and spa in basement, and nicely decorated rooms with beautiful travertine baths, excellent linens. Very quiet with the exterior shutters and interior shutters closed by staff at night. Beautiful breakfast room with high quality continental breakfast plus ability to order additional items as desired. Mini bar in your room plus assortment of liquors and drinks offered in the public rooms all included. I felt as if I were staying at a private villa; the attention to detail throughout is astounding! Can't wait to go back to Rome and stay at the Villa Spallette Trivelli!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience: Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: dmanders77
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here with spouse. From start to finish one of our best hotel experiences ever. Staff very helpful. Whenever there was an issue it was addressed quickly. Fabulous location - we walked everywhere. The rates are not cheap but if you can afford it are quite reasonable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Only a volcano eruption could come between me and the Villa Spalletti Trivelli”
Reviews.Author: McWarg
Reviews.Content: My husband was traveling on business and I was tagging along. We were supposed to spend seven nights at the Villa Spalletti Trivelli but we were stalled in London due to the volcano eruption in Iceland. We eventually made it to Rome, but we were left with only three nights in our trip - thank god we spent them at the Villa Spalletti Trivelli!! Arriving at this elegant hotel with its gracious staff was a wonderful reward for all the stress we expereinced over this failed business trip. They went out of their way to make our short time with them perfect. Though few of the other guest looked like they were in Rome on business, the Villa would clearly like to attract more business customers and made every effort to accommodate my husband's needs and concerns. Other reviewers have described it well (except LaPietra - what planet are they from?), so for my fellow Americans I'll described it this way: imagine that the Frick mansion in Manhattan had been turned into a twelve room hotel instead of a museum and you could stay there whenever you visited NYC? Granted, they don't have quite the same art collection, but the tapestries aren't so bad!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!”
Reviews.Author: lauramaria36
Reviews.Content: that sums up our stay at this wonderful hotel. The service was superb from start to finish. The staff were friendly and supportive. Our room was cleaned twice a day to a high standard and the complimentary mini-bar was refilled as required! The hotel is in a central position in the city and within easy reach of all the main attractions. However, it is lovely and peaceful at night thanks to the large wooden shutters...you cant hear a thing! The hotel is quiet, but this is what we wanted, small and exclusive. If you want a romantic break away without the kids then this is the place to stay. It really is truly fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, beautiful, serene hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flappergirl425
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned in Italy, and our first stop was Rome. Arriving early in the morning after an all-night plane trip, we were both a bit disoriented and tired. The staff was so kind when we arrived, carrying our bags, welcoming us, and even offered us breakfast, even though we hadn't paid for it for that first morning! They also let us check-in early, and we relished a morning nap before beginning our day of sightseeing! The villa, by the way, is in a central location to all the major sights, especially the Trevi Fountain and the Colosseum. Onto the room: it was IMMACULATE. The marble bath was spotless, the robes, slippers and towel warmer were all very cozy and wonderful, and the bed was turned down each night. The minibar was complimentary and restocked daily with juices, sodas beer, liquor and water, along with chocolates and snacks in the room. We went up to the totally unoccupied rooftop terrace late every night after dinner with our complimentary drink, talking, looking at the moon, and reflecting on our day. A perfect ending to each day that became our little routine. I felt like this villa was a little home away from home for us on the other side of the world, and I would not hesitate to stay here again on my return to Rome. If you are visiting Rome, please stay here. You will be very happy. Thank you to everyone on staff, especially Daniella, for your warmth and hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Haven in the Heart of Rome, With Amazing Staff and Service to Match”
Reviews.Author: carloChicago
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day stay at the Villa, and only have fabulous things to say about the accomodations, level of service, sincere sense of warmth and basically everything else. We are a family of four with two teenagers, one boy and one girl, and we have travelled extensively and stayed at hotels of similar level and approach.
