Without question, the Villa Spalletti Trivelli is in the top category of venues for those who appreciate true quality and historic hotels, with sincere interest and follow-through by the whole staff -- from management through to housekeeping, maintenance and food service staff members -- with respect to every aspect of not only our stay at the Villa but also our complete visit to Rome itself. This included: tickets that we had asked to be reserved for places such as the Vatican and the Villa Borghese, as well as for those that were offered as a courtesy, such as to the special Caravaggio Exhibition, for which tickets were scarce; arranging for the highest quality guide from the National Trust who was an expert in the archeology and history of the City and region; scheduling a massage on short notice in the lovely fitness and wellness facilities; expert housekeeping services; transfer arrangements; restaurant reservations; and, much more. Our rooms were tasteful, quiet and comfortable. We could wax on, but additional writing would be superfluous -- in short, the Villa Spalletti Trivelli "made" our trip!! We have absolutely no idea on what basis the previous poster was writing his or her review, but we only can respectfully opine that we would think it an anomaly.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed impressions”
Reviews.Author: Alsterhai
Reviews.Content: The Villa Spalletti Trivelli is a very nice located small Hotel in central Rome. With respect to all the superb Tripadvisor reviews we reserved our stay for a couple of days in the Villa. We booked in advance directly with the Villa Spalletti over their Homepage and later by E-Mail. Everything worked well in advance, we paid a non refundable deposit and got our booking confirmation by the same day. Fine! Currently we're back from our several days trip from the capital of Italy. Thankfully we had amazing days in Rome, but unexpectedly we were nearly but not 100% satisfied in the Villa Spalletti. If you like, please find our pros and cons below; it's our personal impression after 4 days in Rome: Pros from our point of view: ------------------------------------- - the geographic location is amazing; you can reach all major sightseeing places and local hot spots of Rome by foot (if you like) ... or taxi - the whole Villa is in an excellent condition, well refurbished and like "a home of a wealthy knight / nobleman in the mediaeval times" - need to say in other words again: the guest rooms, the living rooms, the corridor: everything is very noble and build with high premium quality - the hamman is very generous and authentic designed. Nearby (in the Villa) is a well invested fitness room. - all materials in our room were selected with high value as well: the king size bed, the bed-linen, Flat- TV, the nice wooden floor, the exclusive bath-room with a shower, bath tub, 2 washbowls, a bidet, the exclusive free cosmetics... - the complimentary minibar service was highly appreciated as well: we had a daily refill, the choice of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks were broad. Only wine and champagne is not inclusive. - in the afternoons and evenings we had very tastefully and complimentary tea- times in the living room. Very nice atmosphere near to the fireplace. Gorgeous! - if the weather is nice you shouldn't miss the well-kept garden from the Villa Spalletti ... what a nice place for a short break - regarding the fact that the Villa only offer 12 rooms everything is in a very convenient and private atmosphere Cons from our point of view: -------------------------------------- - with respect to the 5 star quality standard of the Villa we experienced a staff with appreciable english language problems - we're not english native speakers as well but we had multiple "language challenges" with different people of the Hotel regarding their lack of normal english skills. Beginning with conversations problems with the front desk during the check in at our first day, continued twice in the morning when we order "an omelette with vegetables and mushrooms" e.g. - due to the information on the Homepage of the Villa Spalletti the Fitness room and Hamman has been closed: "We inform you that our Wellness Center and Gym won't be available for the time being. Normal routine will be restaured shortly". This was the reason for us, that we left our sportswear at home. Locally I learned that both rooms are already opened for weeks... the staff member informed us "that we've forgotten to update our homepage"... yes, what a pity! - our room had only one window - this is owing to the fact that it is an old building of course, but we like bright rooms at day time - the room had no isolated window. Of course, the Villa is located in a more quite side street, but we heard many sounds in the night, inclusive a loud and long conversation on the street at our first night. Calm is something different. - the room had no modern heating system, we discovered a bad moulding in colder nights with the thin blanket. Because of the fact that you need to use a fan, it wasn't silent in the room during the use. - we are frequent travellers, but when we compare the breakfast to our other 5 star Hotel experiences in this price range... the breakfast in the Villa was a disappointment. They only offer white bread, at one weekend day the bread was dry as well, and a very small range of alternatives. The rest of the daily breakfast offer was not impressive too. Overall, this was not worth the place, additionally the service has forgotten the ordered cappuccino on two different days as well... - in the room you will find a modern TV- System. Very modern; I hope and think that I have good technical skills, but for the beginning a remote control with empty batteries, a never seen before SKY televison modem and all information in italian language only were really challenging... additionally we found no information in the room how to call the reception from the room ("9")... later we learned that we can find it in the map with the room information - unfortunately (at least for me) only in the foreign language I cannot speak... - our experience with the front desk was not impressive too: during the check out process the staff member answered a call and didn't ask something like "Did you enjoy you stay?"... Our summary: -------------------- We had good and nice days and nights in the Villa Spalletti Trivelli. But as you can see above we experienced some things we didn't like as well.

Reviews.Title: “What aWonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen2606
Reviews.Content: There is nothing that could be said to change my mind from stating that this is an outstanding hotel. The furnishings were fantastic, the outdoor area well maintained and the breakfast had so much variety that it was hard to choose what to have and yes it was included in the cost. If I wanted to be petty the only thing that I could suggest would be that a bit of background music whether it be in the lounge area or the breakfast room would just finish it off. The rooms were spacious with every amenity and to have a mini bar, at no charge is just something not heard of these days. The staff were always accommodating to your every request with no questions asked. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Roma”
Reviews.Author: ginacap21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Spalletti Trivelli for 2 glorious nights on our first visit to Rome. Not only were the rooms beautifully appointed, but the common areas were also luxurious. We particularly loved the garden out back. Our room had a beautiful balcony with large, tall doors that we were able to keep open at night to let in the breeze. Also, this was the nicest bathroom that we had hands down in any of the hotels that we stayed at during our week long journey through Rome, Venice and Florence. The staff was very gracious and helpful. They helped direct us to our dinner reservations and made travelling around Rome easy for us first-timers. Finally, the breakfast is delicious! We particularly enjoyed the variety of fruits, juices and cakes available every morning. Also, the staff brought you anything additional (cappuccino, tea, etc.) that you asked for. Can't say enough great things about this place. When we go back to Rome, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary – if only all hotels were like this.”
Reviews.Author: SomersetReporter
Reviews.Content: Great location. First class rooms – exceptionally quiet and comfortable. That should be enough but .. also that rare thing – a great breakfast in Italy, all breads and jams with that home made feel, organic cheeses and cold meats and made to order bacon and eggs for us Brits. But most of all service just as it should be. Discrete, genuine, friendly and efficient. Had we found anything wrong – we didn’t – i have no doubt they would have fixed it quietly and without a fuss. As it was whatever we needed, they provided; excellent recommendations for close by restaurants, transport and room service on late arrival. This Hotel is immaculate but when combined with the exceptional staff it makes for unbeatable Rome stay. One for those who don't want the formality of big luxury hotels and for those who value comfort, friendliness and discretion. Just superb.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BobConnecticut
Reviews.Content: This place is magnificent. Only 12 rooms but each is wonderful. Great beds and baths, good fitness center, complimentary drinks, minutes from the Trevi Fountain, very friendly staff. Holds its own against the Hassler and Hotel de Russie and a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Researched the heck out of Rome; chose this place; could not have been happier..”
Reviews.Author: epilogue
Reviews.Content: My husband had never been to Rome and I wanted him to love it ! I tried so hard to find a perfect place and ended up researching every hotel to death... chose Spalletti Trivelli and it could not have been more perfect. Everything everyone says is true. Wonderful location, fantastic staff, beautiful bedrooms and common rooms... it was all so perfect. An idyll. We stayed three nights and want to go back. Perfection.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Rome or in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Bruno-Bella
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spend four nights at Villa Spalletti Trivelli and we must agree with the other reviewers that this is a top-notch property and a unique experience. Just 12 guest rooms (I think), it's got everything you need - high-quality accommodations, attentive staff, great location - and they really endeavor to make you feel at home. This is the best alternative we've found anywhere to the noise and crowd of a large hotel, better even than most boutique hotels we've stayed in (and we vacation in Europe 2-3 times per year). It is a luxurious property, exceptionally well-maintained, the rooms are exquisitely appointed and large by any standard. We arrived early morning our first day and they immediately made us feel comfortable, giving us breakfast (fantastic espresso, much needed after the overnight flight) and even access to our room to rejuvinate and freshen up. Of course, this may not always be possible depending on time of year and guest load but you have to love a place that makes it happen when it can. The room itself had one of the most comfortable king beds ever and great wooden window shades that allowed complete blockage of light - perfect for that cat-nap on the first day to recove from the trip. When you return from an evening out, you have three great salons, one a very interesting library, at your disposal for relaxation. Not to mention the complimentary bar with all manner of fine liqueurs, spirits, etc. It is a home away from home, though even better since how many of us actually live in Italian villas year-round? We simply cannot say enough about this place and the experience staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but well worth it. An exceptional place.”
Reviews.Author: DB41
Reviews.Content: We picked Spalletti Trivelli (ST) after studying TripAdvisor recommendations. It was the only small hotel we found that received nothing LESS than "Very Good" ratings. The hotel has only 12 rooms (suites included). It's a former private villa in a quiet area of Rome close to the Quirivale Gardens that was converted to a hotel several years ago. The public rooms are huge with 15' ceilings and decorated in what appears to be the family's antique furniture and art. The breakfast room is equally elegant. There's an "open bar" (actually bottles of whiskey and liquors on a table) 24 hours a day in one of the public rooms. (This is one of the few places we've stayed where the in-room mini bar is stocked and re-stocked without charge.) Our room was large and had a small balcony overlooking a public park. There was a 42" flat screen, a king-sized bed, and a walk-in closet. The bathroom was tile and marble about 5'x15' with a separate shower and soaking tub, 2 sinks and a bidet. The staff - Eleonora, Andrea, and Danielle - was incredibly helpful with directions, bus routes, restaurants, just about anything and everything. We typically don't spend nearly $500/night on a hotel, but we splurged this time. And it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “AN AMAZING Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: expatkate23
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for 6 nights for a good friend's wedding. My mother came with me as my guest and we had a WONDERFUL time at Villa Spalletti Trivelli. They were SO welcoming when we checked in and everyone at the front desk was so helpful and attentive! It was fun getting to know the staff. The Villa itself is beautifully decorated and the common rooms are relaxing places to hang out after a day of exploring Rome. We particularly enjoyed sitting in the garden area with a drink from the honor bar and enjoying the evenings! Our room was great! Loved everything about it. There was free DSL internet, which was helpful for us - we were able to keep in touch with home. The linens and towels were also really nice. The free mini-bar is fantastic after a day of wandering - it's just so nice to know you don't need to run around trying to find a Coke or Beer when you just want to take a little siesta. It's all in your room! And for us crazy Americans who love our ice, the ice bucket was always filled quickly for us! The breakfast was also delicious - and we were thankful that the breakfast hours were until 11 am - we had a hard time getting on an early schedule while we were in Italy. The rolls, fruit, juices, pastries, cereal - and even scrambled eggs if you want them - were all delicious and really filled us up for a day of exploring! Also to note: I was 12 weeks pregnant while we stayed at Villa Spalletti Trivelli and was suffering a bit of morning sickness. It was SO nice being at a hotel where I felt like I was at home and I know that if I requested ANYTHING they would've delivered. It was very comforting. My only negative point about the whole stay was the fact that there is no iron in the rooms. I believe this is a rule in Rome and or Italy, however, because friends of ours at other hotels didn't have irons either. We need to iron our clothing for the wedding we were attending so we had to send it out to be pressed and of course that wasn't included in the room price and was quite expensive. But - when you are staying at a hotel this nice, it was hardly worth complaining about!! Just something to note! :)

Reviews.Title: “Believe the glowing reviews”
Reviews.Author: HouTexTraveler
Reviews.Content: I must confess that I am a hotel snob. This hotel, however, lives up to my expectations. From the instant we were greeted at the front door, my partner and I felt welcomed and appreciated. Imagine my surprise when a credit card was not required at check in! The public rooms in this mansion hotel are elegant and comfortable at the same time. I did take some time to admire the Oriental rugs and beautifully framed antique prints. Our room was well-appointed, comfortable and featured a small balcony overlooking a park. The bathroom was large by European standards. I must also note the air conditioning system was superb given that it was so hot during our stay in Rome. The breakfast spread was delicious and featured home-made preserves and freshly baked cakes and breads. A hot, delicious made-to-order breakfast was also offered. The hotel features a small, charming garden that you can overlook from the open French doors in the public spaces, Finally, it is true--there was a complimentary honor bar in the public living room AND in our room! Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous-a gem”
Reviews.Author: FamilytravellerTA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days with my mother. Understated elegance, we were made to feel so at home, despite the very grand surroundings. It must be experienced to be believed. After a long day's sightseeing it felt great to come back to such a special place, have a drink and a few nuts/sweets (all complimentary), relax in the sumptious bathroom/bedrooms and then go out for dinner. At night it was a wonderful treat to settle in one of the lounges, again with a drink and a magazine. It was like in a movie set! I felt so at home, that I even put my feet up! The breakfast is very nice too, lovely homemade produce. The staff are very unintrusive, there are buttons to press in the reception rooms, should you have a wish. For us, a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Words won't do justice”
Reviews.Author: DiBruccolino
Reviews.Content: This place is truly outstanding and if you can afford it, I doubt there is a better place to stay in Roma. The Villa is located about 3 minutes walking from Trevi fountain and next to the Quirinale gardens. The place is a Villa remodeled as a hotel; each room has a name representing some of the most important sights in Roma and common rooms make you feel like you are in a palace. Service is spotless, from the time you check in, (Sir, would you like to drink something in the garden) to help in all type of requests, to the time you leave. The rooms are beautiful, mine did not have the best view but was really elegantly decorated and the bathroom was the size of a Manhattan studio. The daily collazione is pretty good. Bottom line- The damage is steep but for a special romantic treat with the woman you love, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Believe all the positive reviews, it's exceptional”
Reviews.Author: najohnston
Reviews.Content: Just spent the last two nights of my ten day Italy trip here at the Villa and I wish I could have stayed longer. It really is like someone has offered you their villa to stay in while they are away. Quiet and elegant living room, library and lounge areas with complimentary bar and snacks; exquisite rooms; and the most pleasant, attentive service, all hidden away in a quiet nook in the center of Rome. If you like small, refined and quiet, you will love Villa Spalletti Trivelli.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: LDFBerkeley_CA
Reviews.Content: What an experience: a hotel with grace, charm, efficiency, and a wonderfully warm staff. The Villa is just that: a villa. So it's not for everyone. There's no lively bar scene and the location is out of the main part of Centro Storico--but it's a 5-10 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and a 15-20 minute walk to the Pantheon. The rooms are beautiful (and quite accurately depicted on the website) and the garden provides a perfect respite in a busy city. The staff went out of their way to help us: we had friends over for a dinner (which you need to arrange in advance) and had a great time planning the meal with the chef. Being at the Villa is absolutely like being a guest in a gracious home. It's quite a splurge--but it's also quite an experience!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Perfectly Five-Star Hotel I've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: KeyBiscayner
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Villa began with a late-night greeting by the night desk manager, who guided us down a manicured garden lane into--YES!--discreet, free parking in the center of Rome. Situated two blocks from the Presidential Palace, security and peaceful evenings are guaranteed, plus a wonderful selection of pathways to virtually all of Rome's wonderful destinations. I don't know the ratio of staff to guests, but it has to be among the highest among 5-star properties, and the attitude and treatment are royal and genuine; no obsequiousness here, no snotty waiters, no condescension. Truly lovely people who love their work--making you totally happy. We were so delighted with our stay, that I am now sending my sister and her son on a first trip to Rome so they, too, can experience this Villa. All roads may lead to Rome; they should lead to Villa Spalletti Trivalli!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: josefhabas

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel like no other”
Reviews.Author: LindaLL
Reviews.Content: I was intrigued by another review and by the hotel website, but the rates were considerably more than I wanted to spend... then I saw a special package including room, breakfast, massage for two, dinner for two, and a welcome gift-- all for less than the usual cost of the room alone-- so I jumped on it, and what a great experience it turned out to be! Other reviewers are telling the truth regarding the richly furnished guestrooms, large marble bathrooms, complimentary minibar and cocktail hour, excellent breakfast buffet, and the attentive, professional but not-at-all snooty service. Our cab driver did not know how to get there, but I loved the location, on a fairly quiet street across from the Quirinale palace but only a five or ten minute walk from the Fontana Trevi or Piazza Venezia. We usually would not spend precious time in Rome on spa treatments, but our package included two excellent massages in the villa's basement spa. One mild disappointment was the dinner included in our package: while professionally presented and served, the food was more like "banquet food," and not quite up to the high standards of everything else at the villa. (Of course, Rome is a city of excellent food , so it's tough competition.) This hotel is expensive, but worth it if you can afford it. I'd recommend checking the web for special packages, especially in the off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: JLove2512
Reviews.Content: Villa Spalletti Trivelli is one of those hotels that cannot be overrated. No matter what you think you might experience when booking this hotel, you'll be impressed. I stayed in this hotel with my daughter for her graduation present and it was absolutely amazing. From the free mini bar in the room to the spacious room, awesome breakfast and lovely staff, we couldnt have asked for more. The price was WELL WORTH IT and this is the best way to spend a vacation in rome. One of the, if not THE, most amazing hotel we stayed in. this contemporary hotel is in the perfect location and the complementary breakfast here is AMAZING. what a perfect hotel! the staff is unbelievably helpfull and kind. this is the 5 star treatment. great views, aweseom location. It's like staying in royalties private villa. its also around the corner from where you can pick up the Wednesday papal audience tickets. you can also have little extras sent to the room. a friend of mine in the US sent me a cake to the room...
